items.title: Full Stack Engineer (Ruby on Rails) [On-site, remote, or 50/50]
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=34, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=24}
items.content:
This is a unique opportunity to become an influential member of a small engineering team located in Shepherd's Bush in West London. You will enjoy all of the benefits of working in a startup, the freedom to innovate, to explore new technologies and to use your experience and ideas to directly influence the business.

*---- Why ClickMechanic ----*

ClickMechanic is a marketplace for vehicle repairs. Our platform enables customers to acquire real-time industry-standard quotes for repairs (a first in Europe), services and diagnostics, and quickly book a vetted mechanic online. Our mission is to bring trust and transparency to car repair.

Founded in 2012, the company has grown quickly to offer nationwide coverage and is backed by such institutional investors as 500 Startups and Forward Partners, and angel investors including the former CEO of JustEat and Chairman of Treatwell.

Vehicle repair is a huge market, ripe for technology disruption. There are millions of consumers, tera- or even peta-bytes of potentially underused data, with an exceptional logistics infrastructure (parts distribution).

*---- The Role ----*

As a full-stack developer in a small team, you will work across all aspects of the product from architecture and DevOps to code reviews and tech support. Working alongside our CTO & Head of Engineering, you will deliver new features and continually improve our existing code.

Technology underpins our entire business. We’ve built an industry-leading quote engine and mobile Mechanic App. We consume millions of rows of third-party automotive data and have implemented machine learning to improve the accuracy of our quotes.

*---- Responsibilities ----*

* Writing well-tested production code in Ruby and JavaScript.
* Refactoring and rearchitecting legacy code where appropriate to ensure you always leave it better than you found it.
* Reviewing code fairly and honestly; and receiving code reviews openly on each of your pull requests.
* Collaboration with business stakeholders to develop requirements and expectations.
* Collaboration with technical stakeholders to discuss constraints and opportunities.
* Monitoring our production systems and providing technical support to the business.
* Maintaining our development pipeline and toolchain.
* Innovation and self-led learning.

*---- Our Technology ----*

As a startup, we prefer open-source technologies. Our main app is built with Ruby (on Rails) and is hosted on Heroku and AWS. We use both PostgreSQL and SQL Server relational databases and also MongoDB and Elasticsearch NoSQL databases.

Our mobile Mechanic App is built on JQuery mobile and we are planning to rearchitect this system onto a more modern framework (e.g. React) soon.

Our development pipeline utilises Jira, Git, GitHub, Docker, Webpack, Grunt and CircleCI.

*---- Requirements ----*

Your potential is much more important to us than a list of characteristics. Nevertheless, here is a list of characteristics that we hope already apply to you, or that you’re very keen to develop:
* You consider yourself fairly expert in at least one OO programming language (not necessarily Ruby).
* You have built a production web application using an MVC (or equivalent) framework (e.g. Ruby on Rails).
* The terms OOP, SOLID and TDD make you feel warm inside.
* You can write complicated SQL statements directly in the console without a query designer.
* Unix, Linux, Heroku, GitHub and NoSQL are not just made-up words to you.
* You can describe JavaScript as a functional, prototypal language and know what that means.
* You have strong Git-fu and can perform interactive rebases from the command line.
* You’re not afraid to get stuck into DevOps and have a go at, say, implementing Docker in a CI pipeline.
* You write your best code when pair-programming with another developer regardless of their experience.
* You wouldn't write a line of production code without writing a failing test first, because that’s how it’s done, right?
* You read about programming and technology because it’s a passion, not just a profession.
* You see legacy code as an exciting opportunity to innovate and make things better.

*---- Benefits ----*

* Working with leading open-source technologies in an agile team.
* A culture that embraces flexibility, and rewards growth and innovation.
* The opportunity to directly contribute to the success of the business every day.
* A competitive package including company pension and share options.
* MacBook Pro as standard.
* 10% innovation time.
* Manage your own training budget.
* Tea, coffee, fruit, snacks and Friday beers provided!
* Bringing trust and transparency to an industry which is widely recognised for high levels customer dissatisfaction.

items.title: Front End ReactJS developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=34, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=32}
items.content:
OfficeServe is a disruptor in the corporate catering market. Our products and services currently focus on food delivery services, but we have big plans to diversify and expand our offering in the b2b market.

We are a high growth, well-funded start-up business enabling our business customers to order food online through on-demand ordering. Our amazing head office is located at the heart of London’s Silicon Roundabout, 2mins walk from Old Street Station or 10mins walk from Shoreditch High street. The office includes a spacious lounge, roof garden, kitchen & dining areas, an on-site Cafe and gym (with regular fitness and yoga classes), bike storage, showers and screening room! The office also regularly hosts various technology meetups and events.

We have built our products using the latest technologies to create fast, scalable and accessible products that work on any device and deliver fantastic consumer experiences.

Our customer web portal is built using isomorphic React with a Node.js/KOA APIs on an AWS stack. We are looking for someone to take over and lead the front end (and associated back end elements) from our CTO as this area of the business now requires its own team.

The web portal is a key part of our offering and we expect this role to become more important within the business as we scale. There are plenty of opportunities to put your own stamp on the project.

REQUIREMENTS:

A minimum of two years working with React, Node.js, Javascript, preferably on AWS

Practical experience with:
- ES6
- BitBucket/Jira for issue tracking and code management
- Code testing in Javascript
- Npm, webpack, etc.

Useful to have:
- MySQL
- Amazon EC2 servers

We are looking for someone to start as soon as possible. The interview process will involve:

- A phone call with our CTO to discuss the company, your background and the role
- A tech test (which can be done remotely and will take approx. 1 hour)
- A face-to-face interview (at our Old St office) with our CTO and another member of senior management

This role is for an in-house position working at the Old St office (initially 5 days a week while you get familiar with our platform etc but later we are flexible to dropping this to 4 days in house and 1 day remote).

Now is an exciting time to join this entrepreneurial business with huge ambitions! Since launching in 2016, our business has been hugely successful in growing revenue and customer numbers. This growth has critically depended upon our people, high quality products and services. Most importantly, our success is and will be based on hiring exceptionally talented individuals that understand our customers’ value and need.

We look forward to hearing from you...

Please send a CV and we'll get back to you as soon as we can.

items.content:
Senior Front End Engineer - ReactJS

Company: Modus Create

You are a forward thinking, creative problem solver with a passion for core JavaScript. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet. At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles.

This contract role may be performed from a remote location and requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week. Preference will be given to candidates within the Western Hemisphere.

Responsibilities

  • Build a new UI for a successful, growing educational product
  • Write lots of quality, high performing JavaScript code using ReactJS, Redux, GraphQL
  • Collaborate daily with UX, Engineering, QA and DevOps to build and deliver an intuitive, highly visible web app
  • Collaborate, write code, write automated tests, perform code reviews and actively participate on our distributed Agile team
  • Consult to our end client regarding development best practices
  • Work 100% aligned with Western Hemisphere business hours - GMT -4 or -5

Required Skills and Experience

  • At least 2 years experience delivering high value, complex UI front-end products
  • Good understanding of modern front-end architectures
  • Strong experience with ReactJS, Redux 
  • Experience in consuming and/or developing APIs using GraphQL, is highly desirable
  • Strong Javascript basics and very good understanding of core JS (ES6/7)
  • Experience in following Agile/Scrum SDLC
  • Experience with automated unit, integration and end-to-end testing is highly desirable.
  • Be comfortable communicating in a virtual environment
  • Previous remote team experience
  • A consistent, reliable internet connection
How to apply:
moduscreate.applytojob.com/apply/qXWsquEbuh/Senior-Front-End-Engineer-ReactJS

items.content:
React Native Reactjs Engineer


Accella


This position is for US residents only.

Accella is looking for a developer with experience building web and mobile applications utilizing ReactJS and React Native.  Experience with environments / frameworks such as Angular and Node.js also a plus.

In addition to React / JS experience, we are looking for a candidate with a mixed skillset, including experience with native mobile development in Swift, Objective-C and Java and/or experience with Xamarin. While the position will be React Native focused, it is likely the candidate will be asked to work on projects ranging from web to mobile, so we are looking for a more well-rounded individual in terms of a technology background.

We will heavily weigh the applicants problem solving skills. Must be highly motivated and a serious self starter.

Must have the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical resources. We are looking for someone that enjoys being part of a team and will offer feedback and ideas in order to design and develop the most solid and extensible products for our clients.

We want a leader, an ideas person, and someone that is eager to work on multiple challenging projects, sometimes simultaneously.

What we expect in a candidate: 

- BS in Computer Science, BS in closely related discipline or equivalent industry experience

- Candidate must be located within the US, but can be located anywhere around the country

- 3+ years experience with React development

- At least 3 apps in the App Store

- At least 5 years experience with software development

- Effective communication skills (written and oral)

- Problem-solving and creative mindset

- Experience thriving in a high-performance, results-oriented organization

- Experience and proficiency in interacting with external clients

- Experience with Ruby on Rails a plus

- Experience with native mobile development a plus

- Experience with Drupal development a plus

See more jobs at Accella

items.content:
Front End Developer

Company: SR2
Location: South Glamorgan
£35,000 - £50,000 a year -

Permanent

Front-end Developer | Central Cardiff (Nr. train station) | Remote working options

Javascript, React, HTML, CSS

Fancy yourself working for a Cardiff-based, Silicon Valley founded SAAS tech accelerator whose customers are multi-billion dollar financial firms globally?

Where you'll benefit from a flat structure, ample autonomy and no corporate BS. Asides a super-cool office, rooftop terrace, above market salary, unlimited holiday & flexible working arrangements…

This is an organisation who are operating at the forefront of the Billion Pound Financial Services research industry, an industry that until recently has been serviced by dinosaur legacy software companies. Their sleek and modern user friendly software quickly secured them deals with some of the biggest financial services firms in the world, and they are years ahead of any competition.

Sounds great right - but what will you do?

You'll join a team responsible for the flagship product across various platforms - Mobile apps, web, desktop, browser extensions will all fall under your remit. You will help develop new features and functionality and iterate existing ones always keeping in mind the end-user. As they are an advocate of devops you'll benefit from a short feedback loop through continuous integration and deployment systems. The QA team will also help validate your work.

Some key responsibilities include:
  • Collaborating with the product team to build and deploy new functionality and features
  • Create code that is clean, efficient, maintainable & testable
  • Work with fellow develops and designers on interface design, code reviews and testing.
  • Coordinate with the US teams to ensure business goals are being considered globally
  • Learn lots during dedicated R&D time and suggest new technologies
  • Be proactive in respect of customer feedback - add functionality where requested

Their ideal developer will be…

Passionate, skilled and open-minded! You'll be someone who likes to see things through to completion, from requirements gathering right through to deployment. Ideally you'll pick things up quickly, and make it your mission to learn things you don't know and broaden your skill-set.


And will ideally come with…
  • Experience in JavaScript (React ideally)
  • HTML, CSS and other web technologies
  • Source control, unit tests, CI, CD
  • Any mobile development experience would be valued but is certainly not essential



Fundamentally if you are a passionate front-end developer, super keen to learn they do have capacity to help you to plug any skills gaps - so if you are a front-end developer with JavaScript experience in a framework that's not React, that's not an issue.


Apply now!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=18, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=64}
items.content:
React Native Engineer

Company: GovPredict
Remote

About Us
 
We are GovPredict, a Y Combinator-backed startup that has a singular goal: help our clients win their public affairs campaigns.

We've taken all the tech that's used in public affairs campaigns (legislative monitoring, tech for launching grassroots campaigns, fly-in software, issue management, fundraising), built some unique tools (biggest database of campaign contributions in the world, monitoring municipal ordinances across thousands of cities), and put it all under one roof. We work with Fortune 100 companies, political action committees (PACs), Congressional offices, political campaigns, and more. Our clients include AIPAC, American Gaming Association, 21st Century Fox, and 2 of the biggest SuperPACs. 
 
Our team of top-tier software developers is distributed around the world and our sales + business development is in Washington, DC, USA.

Our Tech Stack
 
Ruby on Rails, ReactJS, Python scrapers, Postgres, Mongo, Redis, Elastic Search, AWS, RabbitMQ, Terraform, and Ansible.

About the Job
 
As our first React Native engineer, you will be starting a completely new project for us. You'll report directly to the CTO so that we can build efficiently and launch a best-in-class product. You'll also work with our highly skilled Rails engineers who will deliver an well-thought API for you. Even though we're a fast-moving startup, we still have the resources like a dedicated dev-ops team, designers, and product managers to help you focus purely on coding. That said, our engineers still have a strong influence on product direction.

More generally, as a developer at GovPredict, you will participate in many parts of the engineering organization as it grows and as you grow as a member of our team. We ask our engineers to not only write code but to help us improve the organization. You will provide feedback on engineering operations, weigh in on architecture decisions, interview new candidates, and help make GP a place you love to work at. 

This is a senior level position and you will be our first React Native engineer. While we have other ReactJS (web) engineers on staff to help review your code, you'll need to have enough experience to intelligently code a project from "git init" to launching in the app store. We'll also expect you to be well-informed on best practices so we can set a good example for future React Native engineers we hire.

Desired Qualifications

  • Strong technical background
  • Comfortable with automated software testing frameworks
  • Desire to work with primarily React Native
  • Can take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance
  • Able to communicate effectively in writing and orally in English
  • Eager to learn new things and apply them quickly
  • Ability to learn from more senior team members and guide more junior team members constructively
  • Willing to work full-time with some overlap on US business hours (8am to 6pm EST)

Engineering Culture

  • Smart team: Work amongst other strong developers that you can learn from
  • Remote work: Work from home wherever you live in the world
  • New Technology: We stay up-to-date on new technology and readily employ it in new projects
  • New Data: Work with new data sources that no one else has worked with
  • Mentorship: We believe strongly in leveling up our team members through mentorship and will help you learn and become better as an engineer
  • Move Fast: Our team builds really fast and launches new projects all the time. It's a fun environment to work in where you'll never be bored
  • Friendly Team: Our team members take the team commitment seriously and will go out of their way to help you accomplish your tasks
  • Team Building: Every year, our entire development team goes to a new city to meet each other, do some work, and have a lot of fun together
  • Challenging & Interesting Tasks: We have a lot of complex tasks that are a lot of fun to solve

Apply now

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=2, mobile=33, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=8, java=2, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=81}
items.content:
React Native / ReactJS Engineer

Company: Accella
Remote

This position is for US residents only.

Accella is looking for a developer with experience building web and mobile applications utilizing ReactJS and React Native.  Experience with environments / frameworks such as Angular and Node.js also a plus.

In addition to React / JS experience, we are looking for a candidate with a mixed skillset, including experience with native mobile development in Swift, Objective-C and Java and/or experience with Xamarin. While the position will be React Native focused, it is likely the candidate will be asked to work on projects ranging from web to mobile, so we are looking for a more well-rounded individual in terms of a technology background.

We will heavily weigh the applicants problem solving skills. Must be highly motivated and a serious self starter.

Must have the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical resources. We are looking for someone that enjoys being part of a team and will offer feedback and ideas in order to design and develop the most solid and extensible products for our clients.

We want a leader, an ideas person, and someone that is eager to work on multiple challenging projects, sometimes simultaneously.

What we expect in a candidate: 

- BS in Computer Science, BS in closely related discipline or equivalent industry experience

- Candidate must be located within the US, but can be located anywhere around the country

- 3+ years experience with React development

- At least 3 apps in the App Store

- At least 5 years experience with software development

- Effective communication skills (written and oral)

- Problem-solving and creative mindset

- Experience thriving in a high-performance, results-oriented organization

- Experience and proficiency in interacting with external clients

- Experience with Ruby on Rails a plus

- Experience with native mobile development a plus

- Experience with Drupal development a plus

Apply now

What We're Building

LivestockCity is a farmer's tool, as a well as a social networking platform. We can summarize what LivestockCity is by the slogan, "Connect. Manage. Sell." Farmers can connect with other farmers locally and worldwide and build their farming network. The potential outcome to these types of collaborations are unlimited and exciting to us. Secondly, farmers can easily manage their animal records and expenses/income through our SaaS-based management software. This software will be a continual improvement process and will develop according to farmers' needs. Thirdly, we provide a variety of ways to buy/sell animals, food products, and farm related products such as hay, farm equipment, farm vehicles, real estate, etc. In addition to these services, we also allow animal transporters to use the site and offer transportation services. All of this integrated on one site - an online "city" of farmers from around the world. Welcome to LivestockCity!

CoachList, Inc. (“CoachList”) is developing the sports industry’s most comprehensive athlete development, training, and sports service provider online marketplace. CoachList’s goal is to disrupt the sports industry by creating the world’s largest online ecosystem that connects and advances athletes and sports service providers. We are focused on all sports, sport market segments, and the broader related ecosystem opportunities.Read More

CoachList, Inc. (“CoachList”) is developing the sports industry’s most comprehensive athlete development, training, and sports service provider online marketplace. CoachList’s goal is to disrupt the sports industry by creating the world’s largest online ecosystem that connects and advances athletes and sports service providers. We are focused on all sports, sport market segments, and the broader related ecosystem opportunities.

CoachList has a proven executive team a team that has the deep expertise in aggregating fragmented online marketplaces globally across all languages and markets. It understands how to aggregate supply and demand ecosystems from fragmented user bases. They also have deep expertise in natural search, paid search, lead nurturing, marketing automation, plus customer acquisition and engagement, with the ability to engage our user base emotionally, so our tools delight users, and feel indispensable. CoachList uses industry leading engagement and conversion strategies, including gamification, behavioral modeling, multivariate testing, and world-class user experiences. CoachList leverages a network of best-in-class partners to decrease cost and increase expertise in non-core areas, and leverages its own intellectual property to differentiate from competitors in core parts of its business. In addition, its advisor network of professional athlete luminaries serve to expand visibility and to serve as advisors, it’s low-cost of operations, superior technology, and lean development model poise CoachList to become highly profitable in this growing yet untapped market.

Applied

Job Description

CoachList, Inc. is developing the sports industry’s most comprehensive athlete development, training, and sports service provider online marketplace. CoachList’s goal is to disrupt the sports industry by creating the world’s largest online ecosystem that connects and advances athletes and sports service providers.

We are in the initial stages of putting together an excellent engineering organization. If you have ever had strong opinions about how teams spend more time in meetings than writing code, planning and re-planning deadlines and fictitious milestones. If you believe in solving complex and difficult problems with simple and usable solutions that make sense. Then, CoachList might be just the team you want to be part of. We are a small group of engineers bringing together a really smart and efficient team that can solve interesting and challenging problems in the world of sports and athletics.

You will report to the VP of Engineering and will be involved in building powerful and engaging consumer experiences that can touch the lives of millions of aspiring and established sports professionals. This position comes with a lot of feature ownership responsibilities and is empowered and encouraged to make quick decisions impacting the efficiency and direction of the technology stack. Primary responsibilities would include:

• Learn, Research and Solve complex problems involving marketplace, scheduling and loyalty management in the world of athletics, sports and coaching.
• Be part of a really agile development team and proactively own feature development by coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities; contributing to team meetings; troubleshooting development and production problems across multiple environments and operating platforms.
• Continually updates skillets to keep the CoachList stack on the edge and performant.

Skills
PHP, Javascript, SQL, Apache, Linux, HTML5 & CSS3, Laravel, React.js

What We're Building

CoachList is a transactional marketplace where athletes can book training sessions & appointments. CoachList defines Athletes as athletes, parents, and fitness enthusiasts, and defines Sports Service Providers as individual instructors and trainers, training facilities, camps, health clubs & studios, and providers servicing the industry - who offer in-person and virtual training, instruction, classes, education, and support services. Support services providers include sports nutritionists, psychologists, physical therapists, orthopedic surgeons, among others.

CoachList helps Athletes seeking to improve their skills in a particular sport, parents of youth seeking to improve, and fitness enthusiasts seeking to find resources that help them improve their fitness or prepare for events. Our platform facilitates social networking among Athletes & Sports Service Providers, enabling individuals to connect with one another and form teams or groups of like-minded enthusiasts.

Software development engineer at The Software Practice

The Software Practice is a technology company based in Singapore that builds software for clients and its own business. Our core strength is in architecting and developing large and complex web and mobile applications. We’re a full service development firm who’ve launched several products working with clients from an idea to a prototype to production with real world users.Read More

The Software Practice is a technology company based in Singapore that builds software for clients and its own business. Our core strength is in architecting and developing large and complex web and mobile applications. We’re a full service development firm who’ve launched several products working with clients from an idea to a prototype to production with real world users.

In the past, we’ve built applications that have been used by hundreds of thousands of users. Our expertise lies in being able to architect stable, highly scalable and performant software for the web and mobile platforms.

Our clients range from small start-ups looking to build and launch their product from scratch to critical internal applications for Government organizations (like DSTA - the Defence Science and Technology Agency and BCA - the Building Construction Authority of Singapore). We've also built public facing web applications for the financial sector for some of SE Asia's major banks - DBS, OCBC and UOB.

One of our more recent projects was the launch of mobile applications (iOS and Android) for the Malaysia Airports Holdings Berhad featuring flights, shopping information for passengers and indoor navigation for Kuala Lumpur International Airport.

We work on a number of technologies and tend to hire smart people who can pick up new tech-stacks and get things done quickly. Just in the last year, we've worked on projects using ReactJS, AngularJS, Python, ReactNative, .NET and Solidity.

Applied
Apply to The Software Practice
Add a message to The Software Practice
Apply

Job Description

We're a Singapore based software consulting firm who're looking for remote developers.

We're trying to find exceptionally smart people with strong development skills and an avid interest in web/mobile development. You should be able to learn quickly and work independently - we'll help you as best as we can, but you must be tenacious and resourceful enough to figure out things you don't know how to do.

Openings

- Web developers
- Mobile engineers

Requirements

- Solid programming ability in at least one language
- Clear and precise written communication. A large part of our team works remotely and it's vital that you are able to document ideas, progress and problems with clarity so everyone can work asynchronously.
- You must be happy to work independently (remote welcome) and be able to structure timelines, take ownership and responsibility and communicate clearly.
- We're looking for people with under 4 years experience - fresh graduates welcome too.

Any experience in the one or more of the following is a definite plus:
- Worked on non-trivial Javascript applications
- Mobile development - Android/iOS - native or ReactNative
- Experience with AWS, Azure, Heroku or any other cloud platforms
- Development in C#, Python
- Experience with React, React Native
- Web design experience - HTML/CSS and JS

If you've built something in the past, do let us know. Github and/or StackOverflow profiles are welcome.

You'll get to work in a fast-paced environment, with a great team of full-stack engineers who have a lot of experience in building large scale web applications from scratch.

Skills
Python, iOS Development, Backend Development, Frontend Development, C#.NET, AngularJS, React.js, Blockchain, Vue.Js, Remote Working, React Native, Android Development
Compensation
$6K–$15K

Codelitt Incubator consists of a corporate skunkworks program and a product incubator. Our two focuses are strategically aligned to benefit each other and solve two problems: We help entrepreneurs build great products while making a living and corporations innovate like startups.

Join Codelitt, work on exciting new products, build contacts, get great salary and benefits, and build your own startup along the way. You'll get access to a team that complements your skills, investors, advisors, and resources that you need.

Applied

Add a message to Codelitt Incubator

Job Description

Codelitt Incubator is looking for a Software Engineer with experience in two very different worlds, an enterprise & a startup stack. We’re looking for an engineer who has experience working with .NET and Angular.

The ideal candidate has a passion for being a part of a founding team, social networking, algorithms, connecting APIs, & building useful/meaningful tools for the web. We are looking for someone who contributes to the open net, open source projects & is always learning.

Requirements (aside from those listed below)
•Collaborating with teams
•Architect all components of a software project
•Run projects through solid processes (things like code reviews, reviewing stories, planning)
•Picks up new technologies quickly & efficiently
•Ability to pick the best technology for a project
•Version control for all of your projects
•Understand the importance of tests & how to create them
•Expert knowledge of OOP & software design principles
•Think of and judge multiple solutions for a problem
•How to hand code SQL
•How to build secure apps
•Strong communication skills

Bonuses
•Practice continuous integration
•Experience working with reactjs or similar
•Tinkered with Docker
•Experiment with new technology and are quick to learn
•Interested in startups
•Know more than 3 programming languages
•Knowledge of responsive frontends

WHY US?

Codelitt Incubator consists of a corporate skunkworks program and a product incubator. Our two focuses are strategically aligned to benefit each other and solve two problems: We help entrepreneurs build great products while making a living and corporations innovate like startups.

Join Codelitt, work on exciting new products, build contacts, get great salary and benefits, and build your own startup along the way. You'll get access to a team that complements your skills, investors, advisers, and resources that you need.

Email vincent@codelitt.com

We are a product incubator and corporate skunkworks lab, using technology & user-centric design to solve corporate problems at startup speed. We develop scalable technology solutions on platforms such as Web + Mobile, Machine Learning, AR/VR, and AI/Robotics, for some of the biggest corporations in the world. We also have our own portfolio of products.

Large organizations face numerous challenges when trying to build new business models, products, or ways to connect with their end users. We provide a turnkey solution with the best of startup thinking, talent, and methodologies to bring these products to market.

In order to attract the best talent to Codelitt and fulfil our mission of building great products, we provide our employees with the opportunity to work on their own products and invest small angel money into their products with the goal of enabling them to leave our program with both the experience working in the skunkworks program and a product of their own to launch.

items.title: Senior Mobile Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=21, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=7, java=3, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
Senior Mobile Developer

Company: aware3
Remote

The aware3 development team works in an agile, fast-paced environment, often releasing updates multiple times per week. Developers are part of the end-to-end design process, and often are required to work independently to design and implement solutions across a wide variety of topics. If you enjoy the design cycle taking six months and the requirements process droning on in endless meetings, aware3 is a bad fit for you; we move extremely quickly on all fronts and development is no exception.

The lucky new team member should have a focus on writing readable, efficient and testable code. We don’t give bonus points for writing code in the fewest number of lines. Stars are earned when another team member can easily hop in and understand code; gold stars for test coverage.

The backend stack is powered by PHP (Apache, MySQL), with a mix of caching and queue tools (Redis, RabbitMQ, Firebase) powering performance. Many AWS technologies are employed to ensure scalability and reliability. The web frontend experience is rendered with a focus on API-driven interactions, with a Bootstrap interface and Knockout javascript modeling.

Responsibilities:
  • Gather and analyze user requirements from the team and architect solutions from them.
  • Implement end-to-end solutions from database to frontend with concise, efficient, testable code.
  • Explore and recommend solutions to the team that help our systems function in a scalable and cost-effective manner.
  • Support teammates and end users with code fixes and day-to-day interactions.
  • Own your house. Be responsible for the walls that you build, including writing tests, patching holes and building supports as load grows.

Requirements:
  • At least 5 years of total development experience; at least 2 years with mobile app development.
  • Comfort with both Java and Swift.
  • Proven experience with automated testing (Appium, Espresso, XCUITest, etc).
  • Ability to work with strong independence on end-to-end projects.
  • Ability to interface with other team members, clients and end users.

Nice-to-Haves:
  • Familiarity with Jenkins.
  • Familiarity with PHP.
  • An appreciation for standing desks and multiple monitors.
  • Experience with Kanban.
  • An interest in Human-Centered Design and UX excellence.

Salary will be dependent on experience and extremely competitive for the right candidate.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience: Native mobile (Android & iOS): 5 years

Required work authorization: United States

Apply now

items.content:
Full Stack Developer


Kraken Bitcoin Exchange


By joining Kraken, you’ll work on the bleeding edge of bitcoin and other digital currencies, and play an important role in helping shape the future of how the world sees and uses money. At Kraken, we constantly push ourselves to think differently and forge new paths in a rapidly growing industry fraught with unexplored territory, which is why Kraken has grown to be among the largest and most successful bitcoin exchanges in the world. If you’re truly interested in pushing the envelope by disrupting an industry that some say cannot be disrupted, then we just might have the job meant for you. Kraken is a place for dreamers and doers - to succeed here, we firmly believe you must possess each in spades.

Check out all of our job postings here https://jobs.lever.co/kraken.

Our Engineering team is having a blast while delivering the most sophisticated crypto-trading platform out there. Help us continue to define and lead the industry.

** Note this role is remote **

Responsibilities




* Developing new user-facing features using React

* Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use

* Translate designs, wireframes, and business requirements into high quality code

* Optimizing components for maximum performance






Technical Requirements




* 4+ years of professional experience preferred

* Strong proficiency in JavaScript and ES2015 - 2017

* Experience with modern and legacy PHP

* Thorough understanding of React and its core principles preferred

* Experience with popular React workflows (such as Flux or Redux) preferred

* Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools

* Experience with RESTful and RPC based APIs

* Bringing applications to production and iterating

* Modernizing PHP web applications

* Experience in crypto industry a plus

* Strong passion for crypto

items.content:
Full Stack Developer


Slixa

# **Job Description**

Looking for something different? Come help shape the future of a market-leader in the adult advertising space. We are currently seeking full-Stack developers to help speed up development & deployment of new features and products aimed at adult entertainers and their clientele. This role would be suited to a mid-level or senior-level developer who enjoys hands-on development and would work well with a small team of developers, designers, QA and DevOps.

We are a remote-first company, and this is a 100% remote position. We are flexible about location and hours; however, we are currently not hiring anyone residing in the United States.

# **Skills & Requirements**

You should have a minimum of 4 years of professional full stack development, ideally working with a team in a remote capacity for a meaningful portion of that stint.

* **Front End:** Javascript / LESS or SASS
* **Backend:** PHP
* **DB:** MySQL / MariaDB
* **Server:** Linux / Apache / Nginx
* **Collaboration & Devops:** Gitlab / Signal

Additional experience desired but not required:

Node / React / Docker / Kubernetes / Ansible / Vagrant / Chef

# **About Slixa**

Slixa has been in business for 6 years and has recently seen massive growth and potential to gain more market share with the right people in place. We are a small remote-first team with employees in Canada, Spain, Mexico, Romania & the Phillipines. Work from anywhere in the world without taking a hit to your salary. We offer competitive wages and a fun, informal working environment.

Requirements

Interested in coming to work for Slixa? Send us an email with the following info:* Brief description of your skills and experience (linkedin will do)* Your current country of residence and the hours you keep* Whether or not you've worked with a remote team before* Github or Portfolio link

See more jobs at Slixa

Job Description

Do you have a track record of building good web interfaces from scratch? We're seeking someone who pays exceptional attention to detail and has a passion for creating attractive and functional online experiences.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
Minimum 1-2 year of experience designing / coding Websites and User Interfaces
Expert knowledge of XHTML,HTML,HTML5,CSS2,CSS3
Must be able to take Photoshop PSDs and convert them into working cross browser and cross resolution html in minimal time
Strong understanding of javascript frameworks(preferably Jquery),css normalization,moderizer,media queries, cross-browser/cross-platform issues and how to prevent and resolve them
Experience in using web developer browser tools/firebug etc to detect front-end coding issues and troubleshoot them
Good understanding of UI design principles & to write reusable code for UI components
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering effective web-based prototypes under tight time constraints
Excellent Communication skills
Passionate about ideating products.
We strongly believe that good design is as little design as possible. Our design philosophy has always been a mix of simplicity,minimalist yet appealing

WHAT IS EXPECTED FROM YOU?
Ability to continuously create mind blowing themes for online stores
Conceptualize low fidelity wireframes and mockups using Balsamiq/Photoshop
Good understanding of grid layouts,color,web typography and fonts in interface/graphic design
Create pixel-perfect marketing illustrations, promotional banner graphics,microsites and icons for the print and web as needed
Experience in designing newsletters

GOOD TO HAVES:
Good understanding of user-centred design/ human factors,Responsive Design-fluid layouts & Ajax programming
Knowledge-Illustrator,Dreamweaver,CorelDraw
Ability to create animated GIFs

Please share your design portfolio (egs- graphic design,interaction design,pixel-perfect icon/illustrations work and clear visuals)

Skills
Javascript, Graphic Design, Dreamweaver, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, CSS2-CSS3, HTML5, JSON / XML / HTML / Javascript / JQuery, Photoshop X4 Illustrator In-Design CorelDraw

items.content:
React Developer


X-team


Most important:


* Experience with React and Redux

* Experience with Sass, Less and/or CSS Modules

* Experience with Webpack

* Ability to build and improve a REST/JSON API client

* Ability to debug API responses

* Write high-performance, reusable code for UI components




Nice to have:


* Experience with working remotely

* Familiar/involved with open­ source projects




Personal:


* Independent, self-motivated

* Fluent in English, written and spoken

* Proven track record of always learning and growing

* Proactive attitude

* Possess a spirit of generosity




Perks:


* Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc...

* Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.

* Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.

* Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to learn new skills together in study groups, join clubs (photography, gaming, etc.) and get free camera equipment/games/conferences/courses/massages/etc., charitable fundraisers, fitness & yoga programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.

* We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day.

items.title: Javascript UI Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
JavaScript UI Developer


Roostermoney


ABOUT ROOSTERMONEY:
RoosterMoney is a pocket money & allowance tracking app that helps parents teach their kids the value of money in a digital age. Simple, progressive and gameful, we bring to life all the sound traditional financial principles we were brought up with (or wish we were!) and make managing money smart, fun & relevant for the modern world.
We believe the world would be a better place if we all talked about money a little earlier on in life. Research shows that our money habits are formed by the age of seven. Thats a pretty amazing opportunity to help give kids a head-start in building habits that will stick with them for life.


WHY ROOSTERMONEY?RoosterMoney has been featured in The Times, Telegraph, Guardian, FT, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Australian Herald to name a few. Hundreds of thousands of families have downloaded the RoosterMoney app since our launch in January 2016. We are looking for a talented and motivated senior UI developer to join our team to help us achieve even more amazing things. We have a generous share option scheme and youll be joining us as we expand across a number of new territories.


THE ROLE:
We're looking for a software developer who has held mid-senior positions on front-end engineering teams, who will operate with a high level of autonomy.
You will be developing our core RoosterMoney app and working across the platform as a whole within our small but growing product team (currently 8), building an application that is used by families around the world. You have a passion for UX and UI, best practice development and building a product that delights users on a daily basis, taking pride in shipping quality code that is easy to test, maintain and build on. You care deeply about building applications with well thought out architecture.


Aside from developing front-end applications, we expect you will also become involved with ops and back-end work with our Node APIs where required.


We are a small team so its important that the successful candidate isnt just technically highly competent but is a good cultural fit. We run daily stand-ups, two week sprint cycles, retrospectives and utilise Slack for Chat and Jira for ticket and stream management. We use video calls to stay in contact and monthly all team meetings (State of the Rooster). We gather together every quarter for All Hands to celebrate successes, share ideas and plan for the next quarter of hustle.


Apply if you want to:
* Work closely with a small group of determined, like-minded people to reshape the way families talk and engage with money around the world.
* Play a critical role in the design and development of our app.
* Ship and take ownership of impactful new features and functionality.
* Develop robust deployment and testing processes
* Share your knowledge and passion with the rest of the team in making the app best in class.



Benefits

In addition to a competitive salary:

* Work with a fun, passionate team building something awesome.
* 25 days holiday
* Pension Scheme
* Employee Option Scheme so you can benefit for all the input you put into the company.
* We will consider remote working for this role so long as you can spend up to 20% of your time in our London Bridge Hub office. We run a Remote working structure as a team (we currently have team members in London, Bristol and Stoke in the UK and Barcelona, Spain) so time zone variance (and travel distance) has to be sensible.




We can't offer visa sponsorship at this time.

See more jobs at Roostermoney

Chief Technical Officer at Sievent

Sacramento, San Francisco, Remote · Cofounder

Sievent's goal is to connect communities all around the world with events that improves the outcomes of its members.
We're growing fast, was awarded Startup of the Month from Comtock's Magazine and was mentioned in Forbes as one of the featured startups on Dreamfunded.

Applied
Apply to Sievent
Add a message to Sievent
Apply

Job Description

**********
This is a Co-Founder role and we are only offering equity & commission for this position at this time until we close our seed round.
**********

As a member of the executive team we looking for someone to contribute to company vision, culture, leadership and product direction. Culturally, we're looking for somebody that can work across different areas of interest and can work cross-functionally across design, product and business development.

Responsibilities
- Transform mocks, designs, and wireframes into elegant and scalable product features.
- Contribute ideas and Architect to new and existing product features on our mobile app and website.
- Lead and manage team engineers abroad; recruit, hire and manage in-house engineers.
- Enthusiasm and Experience setting up and monitor A/B tests to determine best variations of features
- Responsible for platform technology selection, infrastructure tools, reporting, monitoring, and DevOps

Key Skills to pay the bills
- Rockstar Developer with experience with a front end libraries and frameworks for our responsive website like AngularJS, Jquery, CSS, Saas, Less, Bootstrap, Bower, Yeoman, Grunt.
- Experience building REST API's and worker services using Ruby on Rails, and NodeJS,
- Experience with Github or Bitbucket for Code Reviews and Continuous Integration tools like Jenkins for rapid deployment.
- Experience Integrating Third party software - Braintree, Mailchimp, Cloudinary, and Amazon Web Services (AWS).
- Experience with SQL Databases and NoSQL databases like MongoDB.
- Agile/Scrum expert. Running daily standup meetings and sprints.

Requirements
- Computer Science or Related IT degree
- 2 Years minimum experience
- Consumer experience is a plus
- Ability to move fast, launch, iterate

Compensation
$80K–$120K
3.0%–15.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Keep 100% of Ticket Sales - You keep 100% of your ticket sales guaranteed.

Web Developer at Phötage

Park City, Remote · Internship
Phötage is a fully funded photo-merchanding company seeking to amp up its development team this summer, 2015. Based in Park City, UT, our company is fully distributed utilizing a git repository on BitBucket. We know developers like to work from home; however, if you want to escape the morbidity of summer life in the heat, come live and hack trailside in Park City's cool fresh mountain air--housing and moving stipend available. Read More

Phötage is a fully funded photo-merchanding company seeking to amp up its development team this summer, 2015. Based in Park City, UT, our company is fully distributed utilizing a git repository on BitBucket. We know developers like to work from home; however, if you want to escape the morbidity of summer life in the heat, come live and hack trailside in Park City's cool fresh mountain air--housing and moving stipend available.

Phötage is looking for talented development ninjas who are adept at learning or innovating software development techniques. We need front-end(iOS & Android) and back-end development ninjas who are familiar with photography and file sharing. We are open to part-time, full-time, and contract work.

What We're Building

Wundershine makes it extremely easy to get a feed of fresh pictures and digital art from your smartphone or camera to the walls in your home. Not with glaring screens and power cords, but with a combination of stylish wooden frames and digital prints.

In this mobile age, we create more and better pictures than ever, but they remain trapped in our devices. The walls in our home have always been the prime setting to enjoy personal and decorative content. So why are they still offline? -

Time for a re-imagining.

The Wundershine system consists of wall-mounted picture frames with automated framing mechanism, a mobile app and elegant print storage boxes. Now you can quickly frame fresh pictures on demand. No need to take frames of the wall and mess around with rulers, calculators, paper cutters, metal clips, etc.

It is a complete ecosystem for curating, showcasing and keeping your favourite photos and art.

Demo and details at www.wundershine.com

Company: Arck Interactive
Location: Portland, OR, USA, Remote

    • Job description

    We are a small agency looking for an additional front-end engineer to help us with a variety of projects -- primarily SaaS MVPs for early-stage startups. We're 100% remote and located across the United States, Canada and Europe, so you must be comfortable collaborating with remote developers on highly complex, often distributed, projects. The front-end work we do is a 75/25 split between Vue.JS and React.JS.

    What You Need for this Position

    • Strong (3 - 5 years) core JavaScript experience (ECMAScript / ES6)

    • Demonstrable ability implementing complex components using Vue.JS in equally complex web applications

    • Strong experience with React.JS

    • AJAX, API integration, RESTful services

    • Strong experience writing unit tests using frameworks like Karma/Mocha/Chai

    • Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and metrics

    Nice to Haves:

    • Interest in outdoor activities

    • Experience working on large/high traffic websites and SaaS applications

    • Experience with cross-browser, cross-platform, and/or interconnected systems

    • Familiarity with A/B testing tools

    • Backend systems like Java, JSP, and JSTL

    • Cloud (AWS, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Aurora, SQS)

    • Mobile Development (iOS, Android)

    Apply now!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=6, go=0, nodejs=15, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=58}
items.content:
Senior Mobile Engineer - React Native+GraphQL

Company: Chomp

We are looking for a talented individual who can help us to shape our product and culture from a long-term perspective.

As a core member in the initial stages, you will be working alongside us to develop our product from the early stage, as well as, be involved in future stages of product growth.

Although our tech stack is evolving rapidly, however, we are building the front-end with React Native + GraphQL. Experience with any of those technologies is a plus, however, we're also open to speaking with talented engineers who can pick up things quickly.

RESPONSIBILITIES 
- Be involved in every aspect of the frontend development  
- Frequently communicate and cooperate with team members to ensure that all stages run smoothly
- Delegate tasks to team members when necessary and consult with them when uncertain 
- Keep an interest in the latest technology/information to increase the team’s curiosity

REQUIREMENTS 
- 5+ years’ experience in iOS or JavaScript development 
- Experience with React or React Native
- Strong working knowledge or experience of test driven development 
- Skillful at writing reusable, quality codes 
- Experience working in small teams or startups

DESIRED SKILLS 
- Experience with consumer mobile applications 
- Strong working knowledge of network connections for mobile applications. 
- Experience developing products within an engineering team, not as dev-shops
- Experience developing iOS/Android native apps
- Experience with full-stack development
- Familiar with several of our stacks, including: node.js, JavaScript, React, React Native, GraphQL, Apollo Stack(preferred but not necessary) 

WHO WE ARE 
- 5 foodies who are creating a mobile app that we can use with our friends and family 
- We are currently a small team consisting of a CEO, 4 engineers 
- A remote friendly team with employees located in Tokyo and San Francisco (headquarter)
- Successful entrepreneurs and engineers who have built large scale systems from scratch
- Raised $2.5M in funding from some of Asia’s top investors

BENEFITS & PERKS 
- Competitive salary / Stock options package 
- PTO: 15 days vacation plus national holidays 
- Reimbursement of costs incurred from usage of co-working space 
- Business trip opportunities to America (1-3 times yearly)

*** Please understand that these perks are not provided during the probationary period. 

How to apply:
chomp.workable.com/j/ACDD6F0BF6

items.content:
Remote React Engineer

Company: G2i inc

We’re looking for talented React engineers to partner with amazing product companies to work as part of a team on React web applications. We regularly partner with Y Combinator funded product companies that place a high value on engineering. Strong communication and documentation skills are needed as this is a fast paced engineering environment. At least 3 months of React experience is required and full stack experience with Rails or Node.js is a plus (Apollo Client/GraphQL experience a huge plus). 

We are a hiring platform for React and React Native engineers. We have multiple clients that are looking for remote React and React Native contractors to start quickly. In addition, we have clients that are looking to hire React and React Native engineers full time onsite. If you are interested in a FT onsite role please let us know in your application!

Requirements:
  • Fluent with both verbal and written English
  • Willingness to complete a 6-8 hour code challenge
  • 30-40 hours per week of availability
  • Mid-Senior or Senior level Position (3+ years of professional experience)
  • 3+ months of React experience (with a production app)

Nice to have's:
  • Full stack experience (Rails or Node.js)
  • 6+ months of React experience
  • Experience with Apollo Client & GraphQL
  • Onsite travel is not required but is often appreciated by our partners (Please let us know if that is an option)
How to apply:
Please apply using this link: jobs.lever.co/g2i/f6588986-eda0-4192-aa5c-9949ff509fa0/apply

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=24, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=43}
items.content:
Starlight Group is looking for adept, proficient, and highly motivated full stack developers (React JS /Node JS) that can endure immense work pressure and be very dependable. The day to day task are anticipated to require around 60 hours per week for 5+ year(s) - holidays/PTO. If you do well in this role, other opportunities in the business will open up for you offering more responsibility and compensation. This is a work from home job, and we are hiring many new developers to keep up with our companies growth needs.

Responsibilities
  • Developing new user-facing features using (**ReactJS/NextJS/NodeJS**)
  • Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
  • Translating designs and wireframes into high-quality code
  • Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers##### Skills
  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript (ES7/8), including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
  • Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
  • Experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux)
  • Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScriptExperience with data structure libraries (e.g., Immutable.js)
  • Knowledge of Isomorphic React is a plus
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs
  • Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token
  • Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools
  • Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
  • A knack for benchmarking and optimization
  • Familiarity with code versioning tools, this is a long-term commitment.

items.title: Join a Central Manchester team as our lead JS developer (£65k, React/Redux/Node)
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=4, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=28}
items.content:
Join a small JavaScript development team within a successful business about to embark on its next phase of growth.

* Lead and coach a small team of developers, whilst also contributing.
* Working on a varied 3 year roadmap for in-house products, including FLG (sales lead management) and Flow XO (chatbots and messaging).
* Our team is focused on JavaScript across the full stack.

**Who we are**

We're a B2B (SaaS) technology business established just over 10 years ago. Since then, our growth has been steady and organic, and we've built a great business with several £million in annual revenue and very healthy profits.

A few years ago we launched Flow XO, a business messaging and chatbots product. Flow XO is already a leader in its market with users all over the world.

**Our plan for growth**

We're now working on a 3 year plan to accelerate our growth and bring the FLG and Flow XO products closer together.

The foundations are there - strong history, good revenues, excellent profits, amazing people in both the team and customers.

Our plans include a new focus on sales and marketing, and a revamped approach to product, which will see FLG and Flow XO become an expanded product family and see new products brought into the mix.

**The role**

As the single lead developer and coach in the team, it will be your job to work alongside the product manager to turn product plans into well architected software products.

About half the time you'll be managing, coaching and organising the team. The rest of the time, you'll be working on code alongside the rest of the team.

You'll be working on both the front-end (React/Redux and Angular) and also the back-end (Node, MongoDB & Redis) plus anything else we bring into the picture for our new products. The work is challenging, as we're building complex products with interesting problems around UX, scaling, and architecture.

Although there's obviously some complexity in the codebase, we've worked hard to reduce technical debt, achieve excellent test coverage, and follow conventions where possible. So you'll be joining projects where most of the working day is spent thinking about the future rather than catching up with the past.

Our product roadmap means there is likely to be whole new products being actively worked on every 3-6 months, at least for the next few years.

**Is this you?**

* You have a few years' experience of building full-stack JavaScript web apps
* You currently have team leadership responsibilities and want to develop that further. We need you to lead technical discussion to collaborate with the team and nurture innovation whilst always having an eye on the commercial strategy. We also need you to act as our scrum master (or delegate the responsibility elsewhere)
* You want to coach and develop other members of the team around you
* You're engaging, approachable and pragmatic
* You're a great communicator
* Always be considering 'what if', so you can write code and design logic that is robust and secure

If this is you, please come and join our team. Our customers need you.

**The rewards**

This is a rare opportunity to transform something great into something incredible.

A chance to plot the businesses growth and point proudly to when you joined the business, just before the curve takes that sharp upwards turn.

As well as a rewarding challenge, we also offer:

* A very competitive salary
* Flexible working hours
* Part-time remote working available
* Our product team is based in Manchester City Centre in a cool office. We don't care about your gender, race, sexuality, age, whether you have disabilities we need to accommodate, etc. - we're simply looking for someone that can deliver.

**Next steps**

The first step is to send us your current CV and write us an intro.

The intro is important, you need to explain (succinctly) how you fit into the picture.

We're looking forward to hearing from you. Don't delay.

Kraken Bitcoin Exchange


By joining Kraken, you’ll work on the bleeding edge of bitcoin and other digital currencies, and play an important role in helping shape the future of how the world sees and uses money. At Kraken, we constantly push ourselves to think differently and forge new paths in a rapidly growing industry fraught with unexplored territory, which is why Kraken has grown to be among the largest and most successful bitcoin exchanges in the world. If you’re truly interested in pushing the envelope by disrupting an industry that some say cannot be disrupted, then we just might have the job meant for you. Kraken is a place for dreamers and doers - to succeed here, we firmly believe you must possess each in spades.

Check out all of our job postings here https://jobs.lever.co/kraken.

Our Engineering team is having a blast while delivering the most sophisticated crypto-trading platform out there. Help us continue to define and lead the industry.

** Note this role is remote **

Responsibilities

* Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use

* Translate designs, wireframes, and business requirements into high quality code

* Optimizing components for maximum performance






Technical Requirements

* Strong proficiency in JavaScript and ES2015 - 2017

* Experience with modern and legacy PHP

* Thorough understanding of React and its core principles preferred

* Experience with popular React workflows (such as Flux or Redux) preferred

* Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools

* Experience with RESTful and RPC based APIs

* Bringing applications to production and iterating

* Modernizing PHP web applications

* Experience in crypto industry a plus

* Strong passion for crypto

Marketing Technologist and/or Software Developer at Fit For Trips

Atlanta, Remote · Cofounder
Fit for Trips has credibility in the Adventure Travel Industry. We partner with some of the top tour operators in the world. No debt. In break-even status for several years. Acquiring a very large amount of testimonials and positive anecdotes to leverage. Current online fitness software operates sufficiently to delay development if other financial priorities are deemed more important. Read More

Fit for Trips has credibility in the Adventure Travel Industry. We partner with some of the top tour operators in the world. No debt. In break-even status for several years. Acquiring a very large amount of testimonials and positive anecdotes to leverage. Current online fitness software operates sufficiently to delay development if other financial priorities are deemed more important.

The niche melds adventure travel and fitness, which is an incredibly fun space to work. Preparing people physically to enjoy a bucket list trip or an exotic destination or even Grand Canyon Rim to Rim for example is an honorable and rewarding task at so many levels.

The key to the business model is creating a web of high quality content on the web. And, establishing a 'tribe' as Seth Godin would say, which is a group of people who love you and your product. This group is extremely passionate and loyal and stay with a company even if a competitor came along if they felt a reciprocal trust.

Fit For Trips - in the next phase - needs to develop a robust mobile platform to deliver fitness information in order to grow. This is not an expansive list, which can be discussed...

Applied
Apply to Fit For Trips
Add a message to Fit For Trips

Job Description

We are offering you the opportunity to be a true business partner – melding our vision and understanding of the adventure travel and fitness world with your digital marketing and technical web expertise. As the Marketing Technologist, you will have the flexibility to get our company brand and messaging in front of adventure travelers all over the world in the way that you see fit. You will be the catalyst that takes our company into the future, as the category leader.

You possess the rare combination and understanding of modern-day marketing practices, including an expertise in social media, and love and skill for learning emerging technologies. You are a natural problem solver and enjoy the challenges with building a brand and fixing any issue big or small. Additionally, you have some technical experience and definitely know the difference between the following: server-side and client-side code; POST and GET requests; synchronous and asynchronous requests; JQuery and JavaScript, server side handling and database techniques.

In addition, you are:

- An excellent verbal and written communicator
- Able to work with both technical and non-technical collaborators to diagnose problems
- Considered by those who know you to have an all-around savvy for all things web based

We’d love the following as well:

- Experience developing web pages/sites using html/css
- Programming experience with JavaScript, .NET and other languages
- Experience working in a technical support capacity

items.content:
Us

CargoMate Technologies is focused on bringing innovative efficiency to the container shipping industry. We are well funded and backed by one of the UK’s most successful tech accelerators, Entrepreneur First.

We’re developing a range of applications and technologies to record, monitor and analyse container ship cargo operations (i.e. the process of moving containers on and off a ship in port), to ensure ships depart early and consume less fuel on voyage. Our long-term goal is to bring the widespread adoption of autonomous technologies to merchant ships.

Voyages by ship are legally classed as ‘adventures’. We see CargoMate as an adventure too; driven by passionate problem solvers who are resilient when faced with a storm. We reach our destination by working as one crew.

Your Role

We care about our craft and it’s important to us that you do as well. We’re looking for someone who’s willing to learn on the job, as well as teach others. You write code that you’re proud of as you know you and your team members will be the ones maintaining and adding new features to it.

You’ll work on an Android-only React Native app that lets users on container ships across the world keep their progress up to date. Skills in Android development will come in handy as React Native has its limits.

You’ll collaborate closely with the rest of the tech team as we’ve created an initial MVP and are now looking to create a new version that’s will be used on thousands of ships. You’ll build new features, prototype new ideas, do code reviews, mentor future team members as well as have mentors around you. We keep up to date with the latest tech but know that bleeding edge usually isn’t optimal for production. You don’t have to know our whole tech stack but it’s important that you’re willing to learn.

For this role, mobile development skills and culture fit are more important than a formal education. We don’t do whiteboard interviews or ask you how many golf balls fit in a 747. You will get to show that you know what you’re doing by coding on your own machine as part of the interview process.

We’re a tight-knit team with people from many different cultures. We enjoy each other’s company and it’s therefore important that you’re a great fit for our company culture.

Remote work is an option after first spending three months in our offices in central Richmond upon Thames. Richmond offers great restaurants and walks along the Thames during breaks.

You

  • Take pride in your work

  • Are a team player

  • Are always striving to learn from and teach others

  • Are independent with good communication and teamwork skills

You have

  • B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience

  • Strong proficiency in Android development and experience with React Native

  • Experienced knowledge and understanding of the Android SDK, APIs and libraries

  • Experience writing unit and integration tests

  • Experience with CI/CD and deploying apps

  • A high level of accuracy and attention to detail

Get in touch at crew@cargomate.co.uk.
