tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=21, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=58}
items.content:
Company Description

Join the payever team!

70+ employees. Talented people worldwide.
4 countries. An international reach.
1 mission. Becoming the ultimate open commerce platform for business and private customers.

payever started with a simple idea: We want to make buying and selling easier everyday. With a team of over 70 members around the world, we've built a unique CommerceOS with all the tools people need to start, run and grow their business. After 4 years of high growth and international expansion, we’re currently working on even more new apps to enhance the entire commerce experience, and it’s your chance to take part in innovation.

Join our team of digital natives with deep retail and tech expertise, supported by Europe's leading early stage investors High Tech-Gründerfonds and Microsoft Ventures.

Job Description

We are currently looking for an experienced and detail-oriented individual to join our remote team as Frontend Developer. You should be able to translate our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications.

If you’re interested in creating a user-friendly environment by writing code and moving forward in your career, then this job is for you.

In this role, your day will look something like this:

- Create complex applications;
- Write and review code cooperating with a large team of international professionals
- Develop UI components base on our own ui-kit system, delivering the best UX to customers
- Create solutions using our own bootstrapping system to code with

Qualifications

You'll fit right in if you have the following skills:

Your profile:

- MS/BS in Computer Science, Engineering or similar relevant field;
- 4+ years’ experience in with HTML/CSS;
- Strong knowledge of native JavaScript (ES2015+);
- Experience with Angular.js, React.js or any other MVVM framework/library;
- Knowledge with TypeScript & RxJS is preferred;
- Understanding of Node.js and WebPack, NPM;
- Experience with code testing: Jasmine, Karma;
- Flexibility and readiness to follow style-guide;
- Familiarity with Git;
- Bootstrap.

Who you are:

- You’re fluent in English, and a good communicator
- You have an entrepreneurial spirit
- You possess a collaborative, open-minded and helpful approach to teamwork
- You’re motivated and a self-starter
- You’re able to organise and work with multiple projects and different deadlines

Additional information

We’re now 4 years old, but we’re hungry like it’s Day One - we still have the same big dreams and are looking for your help to achieve them!

What we offer:

Our Team

Our people are our best feature. We help each other out, laugh, help, support, and discuss everyone’s point of view, in an agile way.

Flat structure and full transparency

Flat hierarchies and short decision paths mean that more of your ideas are heard, and turned into realities. Less bureaucracy, more results!

Focus on your growth

Clear career path from the start, access to learning material and a plan for your professional growth, so you’ll always know what to expect.

Competitive pay rates

We want our talent to be able to fully concentrate on their work. Which is why make sure you are paid well and on time.

Sound exciting? We think so too, and we can’t wait to hear from you!

A call for a driven developer who is technically minded, and ready for the challenge of building a business.

However, if you are able to rise to the challenge and help cultivate a culture of fun and success there is an equity scheme and a focused strategy in place which will far outweigh the struggles of the early stages.

items.content:
Job description
We are looking for a passionate CGO/Lead Game Developer to design and develop our game platform. If you love to stay on top of cutting-edge technologies and want to create a revolutionary product with us. If you seek an opportunity to make a direct impact in the industry, shine within the company and with outside stakeholders. There is no limit to your role, except your own ambition.
You will be a valued member of the core team and take part in all high-level decision making. You will be responsible for the games tech side and in charge of making it happen. You will follow your passion, be present in the struggle and own a part of the success.
We value attitude, mentality and cultural fit over experience; however previous experience in a startup is a big plus.
Some people need to be told exactly what to do, and when. If you are not one of these people and you have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset, you are a risk taker who wants to shape the growth of a disruptive business in gaming, then we have got the perfect opportunity for you!
Our offices are located in London and Athens. Mainly you will work remotely, however face to face meetings are required following business needs.
We also strive for that great balance of being a team that feels like a family. That means we share feedback regularly, support each other's self-improvement efforts and personal plans, and see honest mistakes as opportunities to learn together.

Skills
HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, SQL Server, MySQL, C++, C#, Java , ASP-MVC, Razor, PHP, JQuery, Unity, Unreal
Benefits
Flexible working hours. Work the hours that make you more happy and productive, keeping in mind time-zones and work deliverables. Simultaneously learn and contribute, while working with big studios and indie developers. You will get the opportunity to work with the best, take on a lot of responsibility and grow.
Compensation
Stock Options program. Joining the Conclify core team, means you are entrusted to own part of the company.

Job Responsibilities

Develop a kickass game platform
Develop long and short term strategies and tactics for growth
Make tough decisions while being aware of the impact on the business
Lead the game(s) production process
Develop and manage Conclify's game developers' network
Maintain and extend existing server applications (ASP, PHP)
Maintain and extend existing web-pages (HTML5/CSS3, JavaScript)
Maintain and extend existing database servers (SQL Server, MySQL)


Required Skills

Have the entrepreneurial and startup mindset
Can do attitude with speed and product in mind
Excellent communication skills
Business mindset. Decision making. Problem solving.
Leadership and Team building skills.
Good working knowledge of back-end technologies and languages (C#, ASP-MVC, Razor, PHP)
Good working knowledge of web-page technologies and languages (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery)
Good working knowledge of database technologies and languages (SQL Server, MySQL, SQL)
Good working knowledge of various game engines (Unity, Unreal)
Understanding of a range of languages commonly used in game development (C++, C#, JavaScript, Java)
Understanding of a range of front-end frameworks (Bootstrap, Materialize)
Understanding of a range of communication protocols and methodologies (HTTP, SSL, AJAX)
Understanding of a range of hosting services (Azure, AWS)
Track record in the gaming industry.
Ability to develop a simple Game. Creative in new game concepts.

items.content:
*Company*

Code & Wander is a digital product studio with a passion for building beautiful and scalable web solutions for startups, brands and ourselves. We’re an adventurous bunch of people that enjoy the benefits of traveling and working remotely whilst still having an office in London. If you’re a dropout, rule-breaker, ex-founder, backpacker, or a talented multi-disciplined product individual, you’ll feel right at home.


*Description*

We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer to help develop web solutions for clients and internal products, whilst working closely with designers and peers in the team.

• You will develop applications primarily using JavaScript for both frontend (React, Redux) and backend (Node, Express, MongoDB), deploying to Heroku or AWS

• Top candidates for this role would be full-stack JavaScript developers who desire a collaborative and flexible environment in a small team, and have a high focus on producing high-quality, beautiful and robust products.


*Requirements*

• 3+ years of work experience with JavaScript technologies such as Node.js and React

• Ability to code at all levels of a web application stack

• Pair programming experience, willing to work collaboratively to both give and receive feedback

• Strong working knowledge of Git

• Ability to communicate clearly with clients, partners and project managers.

• Ability to translate technical requirements into quality programmed solutions

• Focus on self-improvement and the ability to communicate new ideas and technologies

• Hands on, passionate, persistent, and humble — you get things done without an ego

• Willingness to travel and work


*Nice-To-Haves*

• Experience with mobile applications - React Native

• Background in design (knowledge of Sketch/Framer is a plus

• Keen eye for design, user experience and product development

• Knowledge of AWS EC2, Elastic Beankstalk, Code Deploy, VPS

• Knowledge of ReasonML/GraphQl


*Benefits*

• Workations – enjoy company paid trips with the team whilst participating in activities, bonding and drinking (…and a bit of work to keep our clients happy)

• Ability to travel and work remotely

• Discounts on entertainment, retail, travel and more (Apple, Amazon, Tesco, Odeon, Cineworld, Nike and more…)


*No Recruiters*

Applications or emails from recruiters will have their addresses submitted to an endless supply of spam

items.content:
JavaScript Engineer with Vue, Node, GraphQL and Webpack expertise

Company: Gridsome
Location: Oslo, Norway, Remote
Job type: Full-time
Salary: USD
Skills:
  • GraphQL
  • Node
  • vue-cli
  • Webpack

    • Company description

    We're building a Visual Static Site Builder powered by Vue

    Job description

    Our small team is looking for another team member that can help us build a design tool that let you build Git-backed websites for the JAM stack.

    It's kind of like Gatsby.js, but it’s powered by Vue.js and it has a visual builder that let you drag & drop components. We want to make it easy for marketers, designers and developers to work together on building websites.

    It will be open source, but we have a company behind it, so it’s paid work. It’s currently only me and my brother working on it and we’re approximately 70% done. We need help getting a beta done.

    The candidate we're looking for should have strong knowledge in Node.js, GraphQL, Webpack and how static site generators work.

    We are also creating an Electron app which makes it easier for non-tech people to use the visual builder without using the terminal.

    Apply now!

items.content:
Passionate front-end Architect (remote)

Company: Regily
Location: Remote
Job type: Full-time

Company description

We make registrations easy.

Job description

We help great brands get a registration flow customers love.

Our framework allows our partners to grow faster by removing friction in the sign-up process. It is super simple to integrate, globally localized and uses smart data to keep typing to a minimum.

We are a bunch of geeks with experience from building fantastic products and smart user interactions. Sharing an obsession for simplicity we set out together to create a radically better experience than filling in boring grey boxes.

With many customers live, a lot in the pipe and great investors backing we need to expand, so take the chance and apply for a position within our Engineering team.

What we offer

  • Start-up culture. We are a small and highly motivated product driven company. Your contribution will have a direct impact on the product and the success of Regily
  • Become a key part of a great team of skilled experts, all sitting remote but working closely together
  • A career opportunity. Join the core team during the beginning of our journey and grow your responsibilities as Regily grows
  • Flexibility of working from home with potential option to relocate to Stockholm in the future
  • A competitive salary with opportunities for fast promotion
  • Long term employment with great benefits such as 6 weeks paid vacation

You will

  • Create world class UI solutions and outstanding web development work
  • Be one of the drivers in the development team, taking and solving complex problems together with the others
  • Constantly learn, share and develop your skill set

You have

  • As much passion as we for Javascript and Vue
  • A keen eye for UI details, animations and user interaction
  • An ability to take ownership and create quality code solutions independently
  • Documented experience of Javascript, HTML and CSS projects
  • An eye for code quality with experience in unit, integration and E2E-tests
  • Good communication skills (oral and written) in English

It would be nice if you also have

  • Experience in advanced Git strategies
  • Experience with Travis CI and AWS deployments
  • Worked on Node.js server-side development
  • Webview or experience with other mobile app frameworks
  • Worked with performance, loading and responsiveness in web pages

Our current stack

Although we constantly update it and have many different types of backends and frontends, we also acknowledge that sometimes a lot of technical words can make it easier to understand the work. For us the Front-end makes up most of the product. This list is the FE, BE and collaboration with the note-worthy just bunched together:

  • AWS Cloudfront, AWS Lambda, S3, Travis-CI, Sentry, Vue 2, Vuex, Single page components, Sass, i18next, Babel, Webpack, Nightwatchjs, karma, jest, and more.
  • AWS ELB, AWS DB, Node 8, Travis-Ci, Feathersjs 3, jwt, REST, SMS, payment integrations, jest and more
  • Slack, Hangouts, VSCode, Github Organizations, Google (Office)
Apply now!

    • Documented Node.js server-side development

    Our Current Stack

    Although we constantly update it and have many different types of backends and frontends, we also acknowledge that sometimes a lot of technical words can make it easier to understand the work. For us the Front-end makes up most of the product. This list is the FE, BE and collaboration with the note-worthy just bunched together:

    • AWS Cloudfront, AWS Lambda, S3, Travis-CI, Sentry, Vue 2, Vuex, Single page components, Sass, i18next, Babel, Webpack, Nightwatchjs, karma, jest, and more.
    • AWS ELB, AWS DB, Node 8, Travis-Ci, Feathersjs 3, jwt, REST, SMS, payment integrations, jest and more
    • Slack, Hangouts, VSCode, Github Organizations, Google (Office)
    Apply now!

items.content:
h1. For developers, insurtech is the playground you never knew you wanted.

We’re taking on big, never-before-solved problems with new technologies - all while fully funded and facing massive growth in a stable, wealthy industry.

When you join us, we’ll kit you out with a full spec Macbook Pro, likely set you up to pair with another developer and get you into the codebase as quickly as possible. As a startup, we need you to be curious, tenacious and driven, constantly looking for new and better ways to build our complex product using new and better processes, tools, frameworks, whatever it takes.

In our small team there is enormous scope to have your say, to influence how we work, what we work on and, ultimately, what Wrisk will become for our future millions of international users. And we'll offer you some ownership in the business, so you'll share in every success ahead of us.

h2. What you’ll do

As a full stack developer you will take features from start to finish, collaborating with others as you go. You will be often required to turn your hand to something new, possibly something you have not done before; you might pair with a specialist in areas where we have in-house expertise or following industry best practices from your own research.

You'll be working very closely with CTO Alex to build out a micro-services architected platform - the engine that powers the Wrisk app. This platform integrates with many clients from our own app to external data sources and third party solution providers, so there's a lot to do.

Applications are written Kotlin, so demonstrable experience creating production quality JVM based applications is pretty much essential. If you've worked on delivering a mobile friendly RESTful API that would be a bonus, and if that has led you to thinking of tools like Dropwizard and Swagger, all the better.

You should have some demonstrable experience using a modern JavaScript technology to build user facing applications. We currently use React/Redux for some of our internal web applications and are migrating our Swift mobile application to React Native so any experience with RN is a huge plus.

Finally, you’ll be deploying the apps you’ve written to our environment in AWS. You should be familiar with Infrastructure As Code and containerisation using technologies such as Terraform and Docker.

h2. How you’ll work

While what you work on is well-structured and organised, how you work is up to you. The office is relaxed, with flexible working available to everyone. You’ll meet with your whole team every morning (remotely by video if you’re away from the office) followed by a quick tech huddle, but other than that your time is your own. If you want to take 10 minutes to clear your head with meditation, a trip to a local hipster coffee shop or a game of table tennis - go for it. Nobody’s clock-watching. We just care that the work gets done, to a high standard, on time.

We believe in, and practice, the Lean ideas of build/measure/learn, and will be very happy to show you the kanban storyboard you will be building from. You will participate in, and often lead, our retrospectives, as well as presenting at the bi-weekly showcases, to the wider team, which are essential for ensuring we are all on the same page.

We typically start with a workshop to define what we need to achieve, leading to wireframes and perhaps some high level tasks. We refine and test until we believe we have the core of what we want and then we build the smallest amount we can to validate this - sometimes in code, sometimes in prototype. We do regular user testing, rapid prototyping and code spikes to ensure we only build the most-right thing we can right now.

h2. What you’ll get

Our future actually looks even rosier from inside the company, where we can see what’s on the roadmap and who’s expressed an interest in us. We already have investment and support from some major partners. We’re going places - and we want you with us. You'll help build the path that gets us there, with some equity of your own so you’re properly rewarded when we arrive.

We also offer a competitive salary, 30 days holiday allowance (with public holidays on top) and flexible working conditions. We're currently based in Techspace Shoreditch, a short walk from Old Street. Our offices are modern and bright, with the startup-essential posh coffee and ping pong table, as well as indoor bicycle parking and shower.

items.content:
At PassFort, we share a powerful vision to enable businesses & individuals to establish trust online. We’re connecting the human concept of trust with the transformative technology of the internet.

We currently do this by giving businesses the tools they need to automate and digitalise the onboarding, verification and management of their customer relationships - that means customers can be onboarded in real-time, from the comfort of their own home.

Nowhere are these tools more necessary than in regulated markets - where compliance with regulations, such as anti-money laundering (AML) and know your customer (KYC), have for too long been a sinkhole for product, engineering & compliance resource and customer goodwill.

And this is just the beginning - our long term aim is to bring together all aspects of your identity into a digital passport that can be used securely and interchangeably online. We're transforming how trust is established online, in the same way that Salesforce transformed sales, Stripe transformed payments and AWS transformed DevOps.

What you’ll be doing

We’re looking for talented full stack engineers ready to make an impact.

You’ll work with a great modern stack - including ES6 and React on the front-end, and Python and Rust on the back-end. We have a microservice based architecture built on top of Kubernetes and Google’s Cloud Platform.
We empower our team to have ownership across the entire product. You’ll think about everything from architecture, security and performance, all the way through to feature UX. You’ll be developing entire features, including technical design, implementation and release.

You’ll be comfortable working across the code base, and learning new technologies as the business requires - you might prefer a back or front end focus, but you’ll be open to a working knowledge of both.

We’ll trust (and depend!) on you to speak up, voice your opinion, and respectfully challenge. You’ll have the chance to bring new ideas, and become an integral part of the process to continuously improve our product, along with our working practices. We think everyone can teach us something - and offer mentorship to more junior members.

What we’re looking for

We like to keep it simple
* Foremost, we’ll be looking for someone who fits well with our company culture and values - Trust, Empowerment and Growth
* You’ll need a deep knowledge of either Python, Rust, or Javascript (we use React), and at least a desire to learn the others.
* Specialised experience in any of the following areas would be a plus - DevOps (Kubernetes), Security, UX and design

The Perks

* Equity! We want you to succeed as we do
* Great location - we’re central to three stations, and sandwiched between Brick Lane and Spitalfields market
* An annual learning & development budget to spend on professional or personal development, we’re invested in both
* Birthday off - relax and put your feet up
* Dental cover
* Access to Perkbox - discounts to services and products (and honestly it’s fantastic)
* Equally Enhanced Maternity/Paternity/Shared Leave pay
* Generous holiday entitlement
* Pension contributions - investing in your future is important
* Pick your own equipment and kit
* Biscuits… we’re a bit obsessed. We have a weekly ‘guest’ biscuit to broaden your biscuit horizons.

Check out our careers site to get more insight into our team, and company culture and values!
https://jobs.passfort.com/jobs/105219-fullstack-developer
